snippet: Rules adopted in the Southern District to speedily resolve cases against officers are accused of favoring the city, so much so that some lawyers try to avoid filing suits there.
abstract: Several lawyers who regularly handle civil rights cases say rules adopted by judges in the Southern District of New York to speedily resolve cases against New York City police officers favor the city to such a degree that they try to avoid filing suits there.
lead_paragraph: Rules adopted in the Southern District to speedily resolve cases against officers are accused of favoring the city, so much so that some lawyers try to avoid filing suits there.

headline.main: Court Plan to Handle Police Lawsuits Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Court Plan to Handle Police Lawsuits Is Criticized
